positions.title: Principal Software Engineer / Team Lead / Manager
positions.description:
Sterilis Solutions acquired Sterilis Medical. I was Sterilis' first software hire, tasked with turning a contract-house-provided prototype into a production quality system. The software in the device includes embedded real time C on a microprocessor, a hierarchical FSM written in Python on Linux which controls the micro via serial, interacts with a database, drives a touch screen UI written as a mini-website, and communicates with the cloud. Cloud services are also by my team. I grew the team and eventually became software manager while also maintaining direct significant contributions in the embedded code.
- Embedded software / firmware architecture and development
- Project management; process definition and evolution (agile)
- Work with various stakeholders to define and prioritize requirements
- Releasing software (writing release notes, etc)
- Training field service engineers
- Responding to field issues; help FSE’s diagnose issues in real time, identify resulting improvements to make
- Leading SQA

positions.title: Senior Software Engineer
positions.description:
- SW Project Technical Lead and developer creating the next generation of the fire suppression system hand picked by Steve Jobs for the new Apple headquarters. Architecting, designing, and implementing state machine driven software using object oriented C/C++ on an ARM with no operating system, plus Qt on Linux. Created and deployed automated unit and integration testing frameworks (part Google Test, part my own design) using open source tools to make real progress before hardware and to reduce risks when modifying existing software; wrote the makefiles and scripts to tie the frameworks into our build. I wrote over half of the production code yet had only a quarter of the defects.
- Created multi-threaded simulation for software testing and wrote the tests that use it.
- Team lead activities: estimating, tracking, and reporting for whole team. Work with product owner in Finland to elucidate requirements. Serve as primary contact with India test team. Defined coding standards, version control usage standards, code review procedure, and release procedure.
- Software engineering activities: Write production and automated test code, work with product owners to develop and clarify requirements, document everything, knowledge transfer. Code reviews for Qt / C++ application on embedded Linux.
- Other: Defined site's HPQC workflow and conducted training. Created and delivered training material for software engineers about how it's possible to write automated test code for their embedded software that runs on their PCs prior to checkin, and training for non-software people so they can better understand software issues. Per customer request, travelled to Poland to conduct knowledge transfer and was the last local engineer on the project.

positions.title: Senior Software Engineer / Team Lead
positions.description:
I contracted with a global team in Research that created a PCIe protocol stack for a new card using the pre-silicon PowerEN processor. My team wrote code to abuse the fledgling protocol stack, which included Linux device drivers and user space code. Focused on preventing bugs from entering the system in the first place, and then automating measures to catch them if they get through. Established source code control (Mercurial) and set policy for its use plus a code review policy. Introduced developer unit testing and converted manual ad-hoc interpretive integration tests into automated pass/fail tests; both levels of tests are run by developers prior to checkin. Introduced continuous integration ("CI") using Hudson/Jenkins, whereby checkins are built and tested immediately, saving developers from having broken sandboxes/clones and isolating sources of bugs. As team lead for the test effort, I then extended CI to automate black and white box functional tests, running on x86_64 host, on simulator, and on real hardware, and converted automated tests into board acceptance tests that run for hours without intervention.

The program manager said: "I want to thank you for all the work you have contributed to our organization. It had made a tremendous impact to our throughput and cycle time to achieve many of our deliverables making this system a success!"

Environment: embedded linux on prototype hardware, linux development environment. Technologies used: Linux, C, C++, make, perl, python, bash scripts, minicom.
